result.execSummary:
The defendant Chadwick A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$518  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the victim

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Count 1, Guilty, signed, not guilty, not signed

Defendant in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Can not use the lesser included in the jury instructions.  Jury instructions to be changed.  Jury brought in at 9:00, Court reads the start of closing instructions.  Closing argument by ADA Powell at 9:15.  Closing argument by Atty. Schiro at 9:34.  Rebuttal closing by ADA Powell at 10:11.  Clerk draws alternate at 10:20.  Jurors 106 and 114 excused at 10:21.  Court reads remaining instructions.  Bailiff sworn at 10:24.  Jury left for deliberations at 10:25.  Atty. Schiro wants to renew motion for dismissal.  State argues.  Court will take under advisement.  Bailiff tells court we have a verdict at 11:55.  Counsel contact.  Back on record.  Jury brought in at 12:11.  Court reads verdict at 12:13, Count 1 - GUILTY.  Court polls jury, all jurors answer "yes".  Jury released at 12:15.  State moves for judgment on the verdict.  Atty. Schiro states his motion still stands, and is asking for motion for verdict withstanding.  Court extends motion.  Court states counsel can brief issue with expert testimony.  Two weeks to brief, reply due 12/21.  Set sentencing hearing.  Bail amended to no contact with any jurors on this case, or any of the state's witnesses.  All other conditions remain.  Defense brief due 11/30, State's response due 12/14, Defense reply due 12/21.
Jury trial on November 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODITIED
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any jurors or states witnesses in this case.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Joseph W.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
Trial judge -  Br 2
Charactor Reference

Defendant in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court speaks to parties about behavior in court.  Jury brought in at 9:03. State calls J. Sweeney at 9:04, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by ADA Powell.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 10:03.  Break at 10:40, jury excused at 10:41.  Back in 10 minutes.  Jury back at 10:55.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro continues.  Re-direct by ADA Powell at 11:07, re-cross by Atty. Schiro at 11:11.  Witness excused.  Not released from subpoena.  State calls S. Ferhman, sworn, takes stand at 11:12.  Direct exam by ADA Powell.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 11:18.  Witness excused.  Released from subpoena.  State calls Dr. J. Olson, sworn, take stand.  Direct exam by ADA Powell at 11:24.  Marked exhibit 5, offered and received.  Marked exhibit 6,7,8,9, offered and received.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 12:05.  Re-direct by ADA Powell at 12:27.  Witness excused at 12:34.  Jury excused at 12:34 for 45 minute lunch to be back at 1:15.  Back on record at 1:34.  Court has collequy with defendant on his right to testify or not to testify.  Defendant is not going to testify.  Without jury present, A. Dubson sworn, at 1:41.  Court questions, witness excused.  Jury brought in at 1:43.  State rest at 1:44.  Atty. Schiro calls A. Dubson, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by Atty. Schiro at 1:46.  Marked exhibit 10, offered and received.  Cross exam by ADA Powell at 2:05.  Witness excused at 2:16.  Jury break at 2:17 to return at 4:00.  Back on record at 2:58. Going over jury instructions, wants lesser than wording and going over self defense instructions.  State doesn't believe any self defense was there, as defense witness stated defendant was peace keeper.  Court will do lesser included and party to a crime.  Court is reviewing case law to determine if they can claim self defense without him testifyng.  Court states there is enough evidence to jury with conflicting info and defendant is entitled to his own theory.  Court will allow self defense.  Marked exhibit 11 and 12.  Atty. Schiro speaks to court about number of police presence. Atty. Schiro asks for individual voir dire with the jury.  Court questions bailiff who witnessed this whole situtation.  Officers have been excused for the day.  Bailiff will make sure officers are not so present in the future.  Back on the record at 4:17.  State Goodled defense's expert witness, that he has been disciplined or entered into a stipulation with the board.  State is withdrawing objection over expert witness.  Defense makes motion to dismiss.  Court states there is evidence to move forward.  Motion is denied.  Jury brought in at 4:20.  Atty. Schiro calls Dr. V. Masci, sworn, direct exam by Atty. Schiro at 4:21.  Cross exam by ADA Powell at 4:44.  Re-direct by Atty. Schiro at 4:48.  Witness released.  Defense rests at 4:49.  States does not have rebuttal witness.  Jury excused at 4:50 to return by 8:30.  Atty. Schiro makes motion to dismiss. Court denies motion.  Exhibit 11 offered and received.  Atty. Schiro withdraws exhibit 12.  Court goes over jury instuctions.  Court adjourned a 5:00.

Defendant in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Valerian Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Back on the record at 2:21.  Court goes over prior convictions.  Jury brought in at 2:30.  Clerk swears final jury.  COurt reads openig instructions. ADA Powell opening statments at 2:40.  Opening statment by Atty. Schiro at 2:50.  State calls C. Jasper at 3:04, sworn, direct exam by ADA Powell.  Marked exhibit 1 and 2, offered and received.  Witness identified defendant.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 3:27.  Re-direct by ADA Powell at 3:44.  Witness excused.  Released from subpeona.  State calls B. Morrow, at 3:47, sworn, takes stad, direct exam by ADA Powell. Witness identified defedant.  Marked exhibit 3 and 4.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 4:01.  Re-direct by ADA Powell at 4:11.  Re-cross by Atty. Schiro at 4:12.  Witness excused at 4:13, released from subpoena.  State calls T. Schultz at 4:14, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by ADA Powell.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 4:31.  Re-direct by ADA Powell at 4:46.  Witness excused , released from subpoena.  State calls C. Mouaat 4:49, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by ADA Powell.  Witness identifies defendant.  Cross exam by Atty. Schiro at 5:00.  No re-direct, released from subpoena.  Jury excused for the day at 5:05, to return the next morning at 8:15.  Court adjourned at 5:07.

Defendant in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties argue self defense, does not want t spoke of, if he is not testifying..  Atty. Schiro argues.  Court rules, at this time, she not not make that instruction.  Bailiff sent downat  11:10 to get panel. Brought in at 11:25. Clerk swears panel.  Court reads preliminary instructions.  aClerk calls 24 juror numbers.  Court continues instructions, voir dire by court at 11:36.  Court strikes jurors 112, 83,93 at 11:47.  Clerk calls 3 new numbers.  Court strikes 84 at 11:54.  Court strikes 36. Clerk calls two more numbers.  Court continues voir dire.  Additional jurors brought in, sworn.  Court continues instructions.  Voir dire by ADA Powell.  Court strikes juror 65 at 12:10.  Clerk calls another juror.  Court asks questions.  ADA Powell continues.  Court strikes juror 70 at 12:20.  Clerk calls another juror.  ADA Powell continues.  Voir dire by Atty. Schiro at 12:37.  Uncalled jurors excused at 1:07.  Strikes start.  Court reads remaining instructions.  Strikes complete at 1:18.  Clerk calls 14 numbers.  Non selected released at 1:20.  Court reads reamining prelimnary instructions.  Jurors excused at 1:25 to return at 2:15.  Court adjourned.
